commit message: Merge branch 'release/3.0' into develop
Moved follow button below blog description to provide more room for description
Blog info now animates into view

Removed convoluted logic which scaled the mshot and created the sticky scrolling header. mshot is instead shown as a thumbnail to the right of the blog info, tapping the thumbnail shows the full-size mshot.
Full-size mshot now animates in from the tap position
Follower count now correctly updates after following/unfollowing a blog, and following a blog you just unfollowed now works
Changed tag preview so follow button is on the bottom, to match changes to blog preview
Decreased duration of blog preview animation
Added adjustViewBounds=true to the mshot so the lock icon appears larger for private blogs
mshot is now loaded full-width for the thumbnail to ensure that the cached mshot will be the same when the user taps to view it in the photo viewer
Removed duplicate ReaderUtils class
mshot size is now based on the display width
mshot is now highlighted when tapped
mshot now zooms from the tapped position

Merge pull request #1702 from wordpress-mobile/issue/1625-add-in-more-analytics-to-stats

Add in more analytics to stats
Track Mixpanel analytics event 'stats scrolling to bottom'
blog info is now full-width
Changed divider height from 4dp to 1dp in both blog preview and tag preview headers
increased blogInfo animation delay
Fixed potential double animation of blog info
Update Passcode Lock library to 0.0.6

Merge pull request #1693 from mjangda/bug/1692-theme-preview-mapped-domains

Theme Preview WebView needs js enabled
Content in blog list is now centered vertically and positioned between avatar and follow button, adjusted # of recommended blogs to accommodate.

Merge pull request #1695 from wordpress-mobile/issue/1694-reader-followed-icon

issue/1694-reader-followed-icon
Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android into issue/1707-redesign-blog-preview
Rewrote the AppLog viewer to use a ListView+adapter
Added UserPrefs methods to get/set/reset the last activity string, now read at startup when restoring the previously selected activity
Replaced all usage of commit() with apply() in UserPrefs, as per http://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/SharedPreferences.Editor.html#apply%28%29
Added PREFKEY_LAST_ACTIVITY_STR to UserPrefs.reset()

add Application Started event

track them.
